content.webTitle: Danny Welbeck will be out until at least February, reveals Arsène Wenger

fields.headline: Danny Welbeck will be out until at least February, reveals Arsène Wenger
fields.bodyText: Arsène Wenger has confirmed that Danny Welbeck will not be back in the Arsenal first team picture until at least February. The England forward has been out since last spring but is still not close to returning. “Unfortunately he was injured at the end of April and we are now at the end of December and he is still not available because of a bone bruising. That deteriorated and it is a big blow to us,” Wenger said. “Especially now we cannot rotate.” Being without Alexis Sánchez and Theo Walcott recently has put a strain on Arsenal’s attacking options and Wenger is frustrated to be short of a key forward player as versatile as Welbeck. Jack Wilshere is marginally ahead of his projected return. Wenger suggested the midfielder, who like Welbeck is yet to play at all this season, could return towards the end of January.
